title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5704.3 - Policy and exchange rate formula
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5704.3 - Policy and exchange rate formula

State Regulations

United States currency shall be the basis for the published
tariff. At such time as either the United States or Canadian dollar reaches an
exchange rate in excess of $.05+-, then Canadian currency used in making toll
payment shall be either discounted or granted a premium based on the bank
exchange rate for this period. In applying the discount or premium, the
official rate shall be rounded up to the nearest five percent and then applied
to the base toll rates. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5704.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
